intro: Atraphaxis ovczinnikovii, commonly known as the Ovczinnikov's desert cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, pale green leaves. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in clusters, and the plant produces small, rounded seed pods. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
